explanation: The report is correct. In this function the local pointer timecb is only used to read fields (timecb->timebase_token, timecb->interval_time) and is never used to modify the underlying object. MISRA C 2023 Rule 8.13 recommends that a pointer should point to a const-qualified type whenever possible, so timecb should be declared as const OS_timecb_internal_record_t *timecb. Assigning the address of a non-const array element (the OS_OBJECT_TABLE_GET macro returns &tbl[index]) to a pointer-to-const is allowed in C, so qualifying the local pointer const is both safe and appropriate. (Likewise record and timebase could also be const-qualified.)
